com.nkoiv.mists.game.world

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nkoiv.mists.game.world.Location
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Global

    public class Location
extends Object
implements Global
    Location is the main playfield of the game. It could be a castle, forest, dungeon or anything in between. A Location stores the background data via the Map classes, and everything on top of it by MapObjects.
    Author:
    nkoiv

    • Field Summary

      • loadMap

        Parameters:

      • getCreatureByName

        public Creature getCreatureByName(String name)
        Find the first (random) Creature on the map with the given name. Returns null if no creature is found with the name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the creature.
        Returns:
        The creature in question

        Parameters:
        mob - MapObject to be positioned

      • setScreenFocus

        public void setScreenFocus(MapObject focus)
        The target of the screen focus is what the camera follows. The view of the location is centered on this target (normally the player)
        Parameters:
        focus - MapObject to focus on

      • getxOffset

        public double getxOffset(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                         double xPos)
        xOffset is calculated from the position of the target in regards to the current window width. If the target would be outside viewable area, it's given offset to keep it inside the bounds
        Parameters:
        gc - GraphicsContext for window bounds
        xPos - the xCoordinate of the target we're following
        Returns:
        xOffset for the current screen position

      • getyOffset

        public double getyOffset(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                         double yPos)
        yOffset is calculated from the position of the target in regards to the current window width. If the target would be outside viewable area, it's given offset to keep it inside the bounds
        Parameters:
        gc - GraphicsContext for window bounds
        yPos - the yCoordinate of the target we're following
        Returns:
        yOffset for the current screen position

      • update

        public void update(double time)
        Update is the main "tick" of the Location. Movement, combat and triggers should all be handled here TODO: Not everything needs to happen on every tick. Mobs should make new decisions only ever so often
        Parameters:
        time - Time since the last update

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a List with all the objects that collide with MapObject o

      • setFlag

        public void setFlag(String flag,
                    int value)
        Flags store any soft information for the location
        Parameters:
        flag - The name of the flag
        value - Value for the flag (0 or less is not flagged)

      • toggleFlag

        public void toggleFlag(String flag)
        Toggle flag on or off. If Flag was more than 0, it's now 0. If it was less or equal to 0 or didnt exist, it's now 1
        Parameters:
        flag - Flag to toggle

      • getFlag

        public int getFlag(String flag)
        Return the value for the given flag
        Parameters:
        flag - Desired flag
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the flag

      • isFlagged

        public boolean isFlagged(String flag)
        Check if the Location has the given flag
        Parameters:
        flag - Flag to check
        Returns:
        returns true if Location has given flag at more than 0
